isis.stitle: FRONT DRIVE AXLE WHEEL ENDS: FABCO SDA-12 - DISASSEMBLY - SEPARATE LOWER KING PIN BRACKET AND KING PIN

svcproc.title: SEPARATE LOWER KING PIN BRACKET AND KING PIN

step1.para: The lower kingpin ball stud and the lower kingpin bearing are exposed for inspection after the spindle yoke has been removed (refer to Figure 27). Back off the lower kingpin locknut before removing the kingpin and steering arm bracket from the spindle yoke.

figure.caption: Figure 27. Separating Lower King Pin Bracket from Spindle Yoke

step1.para: After the locknut is loose, remove the four bracket to yoke bolts.
Remove the lower kingpin ball stud assembly.

An Allen wrench or six-pointed socket may be used to turn the stud. In the event neither of the tools are available, a tool to turn the ball stud can be made locally by welding a nut to a capscrew with same size head to fit the stud socket. A standard socket or wrench may be used to turn out the stud.
Remove the kingpin stud from the bracket.
If the lower kingpin bearing is to be replaced, drive the bearing out of the suspension yoke by pushing on the lower kingpin disc.
